summary: Subtle adjustment to the male skeleton.nif file
descriptionHtml:
Just a quick little mod. I always liked the idea of the Better Male Skeleton mod thats been out for ages but it was just too exaggerated to my 
tastes. In a fit of experimentation, I sorted out how to adjust my own skeleton to be more in tune with what I wanted the male body to look 
like.

Honestly this hasn\'t been very thoroughly tested, but I figured I would release it while I am thinking about it, otherwise it will never see 
the light of day. 

The adjustments I made were to narrow the hips slightly, lengthen the legs a little, lengthen the arms and widen the shoulders a bit and 
broaden the chest just a tad. The changes are fairly small but together they make for a much more interesting torso, in my mind. 

Unless I run into something fantastically wrong with this setup, I will likely never touch this mod again, but with the dearth of male 
related mods out there, I felt it was my duty to make available something that other folks may enjoy.

Compatibility;
This mod is not compatible with any mod that alters the skeleton.nif file. If you have a mod that does and you want to use my skeleton as well, just post in the comments section and I will see what I can do.

Installation;

Just drag and drop, if you have unpacked your .bsa files then you may be asked to overwrite the vanilla skeleton.nif, 
just replace it and you\'re ready to rock

Uninstallation;
Just head to 
meshes/actors/character/character assets/skeleton.nif 
and delete that file to use the vanilla skeleton again.

Credits;
BGS for making Skyrim so awesome
Nexus for hosting all these wonderful mods
chrisvorster for inspiring this mod with his Better Male Skeletons mod
author: Earrindo
